mechanics.name: Acting
desc: Players must perform, speak in character, or pantomime to communicate or trigger effects; performance constraints add tension and laughter while limiting precision.

mechanics.name: Action Drafting
desc: Players pick actions from a shared pool such that taken actions are unavailable or pricier for others that round; denial and tempo management are core.

mechanics.name: Action Points
desc: Each turn a budget of points can be spent on actions in any order; flexibility and sequencing create combo turns and tempo trade‑offs.

mechanics.name: Action Queue
desc: Players queue actions for later resolution (FIFO or phase‑based), enabling delayed combos and bluffing around timing windows.

mechanics.name: Advantage Token
desc: A token grants priority, tie‑breaks, or small bonuses and may pass based on triggers; it’s a subtle but impactful tempo lever.

mechanics.name: Alliances
desc: Players form agreements (binding or not) to pursue shared goals; diplomacy, promises, and timing of betrayal shape outcomes.

mechanics.name: Area Control
desc: Players compete to have the most presence in regions when scoring triggers; brinkmanship and timing are central.

mechanics.name: Auction/Bidding
desc: Players bid resources via English, Dutch, turn‑order, sealed, etc., to win items or privileges; valuation and psychology dominate.

mechanics.name: Automatic Resource Growth
desc: Income increases automatically by step or threshold without actions; supports engine arcs but must be bounded to prevent runaway leads.

mechanics.name: Betting and Bluffing
desc: Players stake resources on uncertain outcomes and may mislead opponents; works best with clear odds and counterplay.

mechanics.name: Bribery
desc: Pay others or the system to alter outcomes (votes, turn order, permissions); adds negotiation density with explicit costs.

mechanics.name: Campaign / Battle Card Driven
desc: Multi‑use cards drive events and operations in historical or campaign frameworks; sequencing and hand timing dominate.

mechanics.name: Card Drafting
desc: Pick one from a pool and pass the rest; visibility and table reads drive signaling and hate‑drafting.

mechanics.name: Catch the Leader
desc: Rubber‑band mechanisms pull trailers toward leaders via bonuses or discounts; tuning must avoid erasing skill.

mechanics.name: Chaining
desc: Effects trigger other effects producing cascades; development must bound ceilings to avoid runaway turns.

mechanics.name: Chit-Pull System
desc: Activation order comes from drawing labeled chits; models fog of war and variable tempo via bag composition.

mechanics.name: Communication Limits
desc: Rules restrict table talk or info sharing; promotes coordination without quarterbacking in co‑ops.

mechanics.name: Connections
desc: Players create or deduce relationships between items or nodes; common in party deduction and word association games.

mechanics.name: Cooperative Game
desc: All players vs system with shared win/loss; coordination, risk management, and hidden info mitigate quarterbacking.

mechanics.name: Cube Tower
desc: A tower randomizes outcomes with short‑term memory—dropped cubes can reappear later; suspenseful and tactile.

mechanics.name: Deck, Bag, or Pool Building
desc: Start weak and improve future draws by acquiring and culling; probability management is central.

mechanics.name: Deduction
desc: Use clues and inference to identify hidden information; progress requires clean clue structures and cadence.

mechanics.name: Delayed Purchase
desc: Reserve items now and pay later, separating commitment from payment and enabling tempo plays.

mechanics.name: Dexterity
desc: Physical skill (flicking, stacking, balancing) matters; accessible, chaotic, and tactile.

mechanics.name: Dice Rolling
desc: Random inputs resolved by dice; mitigation (rerolls, modifiers) keeps decisions meaningful.

mechanics.name: Die Icon Resolution
desc: Dice show icons that convert into actions/resources; mapping symbols to effects is the puzzle.

mechanics.name: End Game Bonuses
desc: Scoring conditions pay out at the end, shaping long‑term incentives and bluffing.

mechanics.name: Events
desc: Random or scripted events change state, pacing the game with opportunities and threats.

mechanics.name: Grid Movement
desc: Units move cell‑to‑cell on square/hex grids with costs and terrain; tactical clarity results.

mechanics.name: Hand Management
desc: Sequence limited cards for maximum multi‑turn impact; opportunity cost is the core tension.

mechanics.name: Hidden Movement
desc: One side moves secretly while others deduce location; asymmetric cat‑and‑mouse.

mechanics.name: Hidden Roles
desc: Secret identities or objectives drive table talk and inference; requires clean accusation rules.

mechanics.name: Hidden Victory Points
desc: Some points are concealed until end; reduces kingmaking and preserves suspense.

mechanics.name: Hot Potato
desc: A liability passes around; being stuck at key times yields penalties; tempo spikes and pass windows matter.

mechanics.name: I Cut, You Choose
desc: One splits, another picks; self‑balancing division punishes unfair splits.

mechanics.name: Impulse Movement
desc: Activation alternates by impulses/areas with limited actions; granular tempo common in wargames.

mechanics.name: Income
desc: Periodic inflows from holdings; predictable cash‑flow anchors planning.

mechanics.name: Investment
desc: Commit resources now for uncertain/delayed returns; valuation and liquidity constraints matter.

mechanics.name: King of the Hill
desc: Compete to occupy a valuable location for ongoing points; dynamic clashes over a focal point.

mechanics.name: Ladder Climbing
desc: Play higher‑ranked sets/sequences than prior plays; tempo and partnerships shape control.

mechanics.name: Layering
desc: Stack components to cover/reveal icons or effects; visual clarity is paramount.

mechanics.name: Legacy Game
desc: Game state persists and evolves across sessions with permanent changes; strong narrative arc.

mechanics.name: Line Drawing
desc: Draw lines to claim routes, enclose areas, or meet spatial goals; common in roll‑and‑writes.

mechanics.name: Line of Sight
desc: Effects depend on unobstructed visibility paths; terrain/elevation rules are key.

mechanics.name: Loans
desc: Borrow now with interest/penalties later; tempo vs burden trade‑off.

mechanics.name: Lose a Turn
desc: Miss an entire turn due to penalties/randomness; should be used sparingly or compensated.

mechanics.name: Mancala
desc: Sow pieces around pits; deterministic tempo puzzles with capture/extra‑move rules.

mechanics.name: Market
desc: Prices and availability respond to supply/demand; timing buys/sells is core.

mechanics.name: Matching
desc: Match symbols/colors/features to trigger effects; used in set collection/tile placement.

mechanics.name: Memory
desc: Track hidden information locations for advantage; often softened with partial visibility.

mechanics.name: Modular Board
desc: Map changes each play via tiles/modules; layout drives access and balance.

mechanics.name: Move Through Deck
desc: Cycle through decks repeatedly to control cadence of encounters; throughput is a resource.

mechanics.name: Movement Points
desc: Spend an allowance to move across edges/terrain; costs create trade‑offs.

mechanics.name: Movement Template
desc: Templates/rulers define turns/drifts; common in miniatures for precise maneuver.

mechanics.name: Negotiation
desc: Bargain to align interests via trades/promises; time limits avoid stalemates.

mechanics.name: Network and Route Building
desc: Connect locations to unlock access/deliveries; topology and chokepoints shape races.

mechanics.name: Paper-and-Pencil
desc: Write/draw to record progress; pairs with dice/cards for input randomness.

mechanics.name: Passed Action Token
desc: A token passes to change turn order or grant bonuses; enables tempo manipulation.

mechanics.name: Pattern Recognition
desc: Identify/create symbol/shape patterns to score or trigger effects; puzzle‑y scanning.

mechanics.name: Pick-up and Deliver
desc: Transport goods from sources to destinations efficiently; logistics and blocking.

mechanics.name: Pieces as Map
desc: Component arrangement forms the navigable map; emergent board from play.

mechanics.name: Player Anticipation
desc: Forecast opponents’ likely choices and plan counters; often via simultaneous selection.

mechanics.name: Player Elimination
desc: Players can be knocked out before game end; increases stakes but risks downtime.

mechanics.name: Player Judge
desc: A rotating judge picks winning submissions; humor/meta drive outcomes.

mechanics.name: Point to Point Movement
desc: Movement along predefined node connections; chokepoints create strategy.

mechanics.name: Predictive Bid
desc: Secretly predict outcomes/quotas and score based on accuracy; risk management layer.

mechanics.name: Prisoner's Dilemma
desc: Cooperate or defect with payoff matrices; iterated interaction shapes meta.

mechanics.name: Programmed Movement
desc: Pre‑select sequences and resolve together; plans collide in surprising ways.

mechanics.name: Push Your Luck
desc: Continue for bigger reward at risk of busting; psychology and odds shape choices.

mechanics.name: Race
desc: Be first to a goal/threshold; tempo and route optimization dominate.

mechanics.name: Random Production
desc: Resource outputs depend on randomizers; players manage exposure/mitigation.

mechanics.name: Real-Time
desc: Timed simultaneous action; simple interfaces reduce rules overhead under pressure.

mechanics.name: Rock-Paper-Scissors
desc: Cyclic dominance resolution; best as a sub‑system with meaningful stakes.

mechanics.name: Role Playing
desc: Evolving characters with stats/gear choices; story arcs over sessions.

mechanics.name: Roles with Asymmetric Information
desc: Different players possess unique private knowledge; timing reveals is strategic.

mechanics.name: Roll / Spin and Move
desc: Random movement advances pieces; depth comes from layers around the movement.

mechanics.name: Rondel
desc: Action wheel where moving farther costs more; position planning is central.

mechanics.name: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game
desc: Structured scenarios and linked campaigns with persistence; narrative pacing matters.

mechanics.name: Score-and-Reset Game
desc: Score within rounds then reset; repeated mini‑games emphasize consistency.

mechanics.name: Secret Unit Deployment
desc: Place units/resources secretly then reveal; bluffing around placement.

mechanics.name: Semi-Cooperative Game
desc: Players must avoid group loss but pursue personal victory; tension between help and self‑interest.

mechanics.name: Set Collection
desc: Collect related items with non‑linear scoring; commitment and denial race.

mechanics.name: Simultaneous Action Selection
desc: Choose actions in secret and reveal; reduces downtime and adds mind‑games.

mechanics.name: Singing
desc: Sing/rhythm prompts as part of play; party‑energy constraint.

mechanics.name: Single Loser Game
desc: Only one player loses; everyone else wins; focus on avoiding the losing condition.

mechanics.name: Slide/Push
desc: Slide rows/columns or stacks to change the state; tactile spatial tempo.

mechanics.name: Solo / Solitaire Game
desc: Single player vs system puzzle or automa; clarity and speed matter.

mechanics.name: Speed Matching
desc: Race to match patterns/symbols; reflex and scanning heavy.

mechanics.name: Stacking and Balancing
desc: Physically balance stacks; clear end states and component tolerances matter.

mechanics.name: Stock Holding
desc: Buy/sell shares that pay dividends or grant control; valuation and timing.

mechanics.name: Storytelling
desc: Narrate outcomes based on prompts/icons; bounded prompts keep pace.

mechanics.name: Sudden Death Ending
desc: Trigger ends the game immediately; thresholds must be visible for planning.

mechanics.name: Take That
desc: Directly hinder opponents via curses/removal; include defenses to avoid lockouts.

mechanics.name: Team-Based Game
desc: Fixed teams with shared goals; communication/information rules define tone.

mechanics.name: Tech Trees / Tech Tracks
desc: Unlock abilities along tracks/branches; snowballing checked via costs/caps.

mechanics.name: Three Dimensional Movement
desc: Movement in x/y/z axes; visualization tools keep state clear.

mechanics.name: Tile Placement
desc: Place tiles under adjacency rules to build maps/patterns/engines; spatial tactics.

mechanics.name: Time Track
desc: Turn order by time cost; the furthest back acts next; time is the resource.

mechanics.name: Track Movement
desc: Advance markers on tracks to mark progress/income/thresholds; branch points add interest.

mechanics.name: Trading
desc: Exchange goods/money/promises; enforceability and info symmetry set tone.

mechanics.name: Traitor Game
desc: Hidden saboteur works against group; suspicion and defense shape play.

mechanics.name: Trick-taking
desc: Follow suit/trump to win tricks; inference and distribution create depth.

mechanics.name: Tug of War
desc: Opposed marker shifts along a track; swing tuning prevents inevitability.

mechanics.name: Variable Phase Order
desc: Phase order changes between rounds by rule or influence; timing recalculation.

mechanics.name: Variable Player Powers
desc: Each player has unique powers; asymmetry multiplies strategy space.

mechanics.name: Variable Set-up
desc: Initial conditions vary per play; prevents solved openings.

mechanics.name: Victory Points as a Resource
desc: VP can be spent for actions; tension between immediacy and final score.

mechanics.name: Voting
desc: Ballots resolve group choices; thresholds and tie‑breakers essential.

mechanics.name: Worker Placement
desc: Assign workers to exclusive spaces; scarcity, turn order, and denial create tension.

mechanics.name: Action/Event
desc: Turns alternate between choosing actions and resolving event effects that reshape priorities; tactical flexibility meets emerging threats.

mechanics.name: Act-Then-Resolve
desc: Players commit actions and later resolve them in a shared order; sequencing and initiative matter.

mechanics.name: Action Retrieval
desc: Spent actions/workers return on timing rules, creating rhythms of weak/strong turns and retrieval puzzles.

mechanics.name: Action Timer
desc: A timer limits how long players can act in a phase; urgency elevates simple interfaces and snap decisions.

mechanics.name: Auction: English
desc: Ascending bids until only one remains; classic valuation and nerve‑holding contest.

mechanics.name: Auction: Dutch
desc: Price descends until someone accepts; rewards decisive valuation and timing.

mechanics.name: Auction: Turn Order
desc: Bid for earlier turn position; tempo is monetized and denial is explicit.

mechanics.name: Auction Compensation
desc: Non‑winners receive compensation (money/cards) to reduce snowballing and encourage aggressive bidding.

mechanics.name: Bingo
desc: Shared random inputs generate marks everyone uses simultaneously; race to patterns/hits.

mechanics.name: Boss Battle
desc: A climactic multi‑stage adversary requires coordinated tactics or specific counters; often scenario driven.

mechanics.name: Commodity Speculation
desc: Prices fluctuate based on supply/demand or events; profit by buying low and selling high.

mechanics.name: Contracts
desc: Fulfilling public or private orders yields points/bonuses; requires resource planning and timing.

mechanics.name: Deck Construction
desc: Build decks from a card pool before play under rules; metagame and preparation are emphasized.

mechanics.name: Dice as Workers
desc: Dice are assigned to action spaces; face values gate access, creating probability‑driven worker placement.

mechanics.name: Drafting: Open
desc: Visible shared pool; signaling and denial are explicit.

mechanics.name: Drafting: Closed
desc: Hidden hands pass around; inference and memory matter.

mechanics.name: Engine Building
desc: Systems convert inputs to better outputs over time; compounding value and synergy discovery drive arc.

mechanics.name: Hex and Counter
desc: Wargame system with hex grid and unit counters; emphasizes positioning, zones of control, and logistics.

mechanics.name: Hex Grid
desc: Map uses hexes allowing even distance in six directions; simplifies range/flanking math.

mechanics.name: Simultaneous Reveal
desc: Players choose secretly and reveal together; mind‑games with deterministic resolution ordering.

mechanics.name: Melding and Splaying
desc: Layer cards to expose icons/bonuses; tableau geometry changes outputs.

mechanics.name: Modular Board Setup
desc: Procedural or drafted map setup ensures variety and prevents solved openings.

mechanics.name: Movement Programming (Light)
desc: Short programmed sequences resolve quickly; reduces chaos while keeping anticipation.

mechanics.name: Ownership
desc: Areas/resources under player control confer rights/income; enables taxation and leverage.

mechanics.name: Paper-and-Pencil (Roll-and-Write)
desc: Dice/cards provide inputs; players write results to build engines/routes on sheets.

mechanics.name: Pattern Building
desc: Arrange pieces into shapes/recipes to trigger scoring or abilities.

mechanics.name: Point Salad Scoring
desc: Many small scoring systems overlap; players tailor mixes rather than chase a single objective.

mechanics.name: Point-to-Point (Graph)
desc: Movement on network nodes/edges; emphasizes route choice and blocking.

mechanics.name: Real-Time Programming
desc: Queue actions under a timer then execute; pressure plus planning.

mechanics.name: Re-rolling and Locking
desc: Reroll with locking rules (e.g., Yahtzee style) to fish for patterns with known odds.

mechanics.name: Resource Conversion
desc: Transform resources along recipes (A→B→VP); efficiency chains define strategy.

mechanics.name: Resource to Move
desc: Spending resources enables movement or actions; economy is tightly tied to tempo.

mechanics.name: Route/Network Optimization
desc: Optimize pathing for deliveries or coverage under constraints; traveling‑salesperson‑style decisions.

mechanics.name: Scenario Objectives
desc: Each scenario prescribes unique goals and rules twists; variety through structure.

mechanics.name: Simulation
desc: Model real‑world processes with fidelity; mechanisms serve the model’s causality.

mechanics.name: Story Campaign
desc: Linked narrative missions with persistence and branching; character/world progression.

mechanics.name: Team vs Team
desc: Multiple fixed teams compete simultaneously; intra‑team coordination plus inter‑team rivalry.

mechanics.name: Time Pressure
desc: Explicit time scarcity constrains planning or action windows; increases tension and mistakes.

mechanics.name: Traitor with Hidden Agenda
desc: Traitor has personal objectives beyond simple sabotage; nuanced incentives and reveals.

mechanics.name: Trading with Negotiation
desc: Open bartering with table talk and deal‑making; social leverage meets valuation.

mechanics.name: Variable Market
desc: Prices/availability change due to events/refills; dynamic supply/demand curves.

mechanics.name: Variable Setup Objectives
desc: Random or drafted objectives alter openings; replayability and divergent lines.

mechanics.name: Worker Placement (Different Worker Types)
desc: Workers have distinct capabilities/costs; spot access and bonuses differ by worker type.

mechanics.name: Worker Placement (Different Worker Abilities)
desc: Workers level up or possess powers; placement produces asymmetric effects.

mechanics.name: Zone of Control
desc: Adjacent enemy units restrict movement or actions; tactical positioning and pinning.

source: BGG mechanics taxonomy + user-specified list; descriptions authored for clarity.
